page.content:
CHANGING TIMES IN AMBERLEY
A lady born in Amberley seventy six years ago remembers the Armistice after the 1914-18 War. "My friends and I were playing in the square, when Miss Ruff who kept the village post office told us that the war was over. We all dashed off all round the village shouting, the war's over". The village continues to celebrate various events, people continue the community spirit by frequent fund raising events in their homes and gardens. The Black Horse Pub in the old part of Amberley celebrates almost anything, particularly Christmas and villager's birthdays. She told us many other interesting things. Many trades have disappeared and there is only one shop which is an off-licence, newsagent's, butchery, cont.....
